answers.answer: When I had my son the contractions hurt a lot more than both my girls.
It hurt worse with my daughter.
When I hit my 26th week my OB set me up for a diabetes test i know it's important but I really don't wanna go..  is the juice nasty?
I don't think the sex of the baby has anything to do with the pain difference. I think all pregnancies are different and so is every labor. The sex doesn't determine anything

my oldest was not to bad (girl)  coming out she tore me so i had stitches inside and out she was 7.97. my 2nd also a girl was pretty bad but she hurt the most coming out at 6lbs. my 3rd which was my boy was actually not that bad but ive had practice popping babies out and i learned good breathing tech and he hurt the least coming out and he was 8.9 lbs. we will see how this boy is when i go to have him. i know hes going to be a big baby!
i dont really think it has to do with gender on the pain for contractions
My midwife said that boy's heads are more round than girls...not sure

question: I heard boys contractions are stronger.
title: are contractions and labor the same when you  have a boy or a girl.  ?
